column4: So, I have a Corega cardbus wireless adapter, which uses the RaLink rt2500 driver (which I'm 85% sure is pre-installed). When I plug it in, the computer detects the wireless network in here, but it won't connect to it. the network in unsecured. I know the network is working. Anyone have any suggestions?
does it show up in the network applet on your gnome desktop right corner?
the network shows up there, yes
I don't know. how do I find out/set it?
oh, nm found it. it is roaming
and you also have an wired connection , and are using gnome?
wired connection works fine, though is not connected while trying the wireless (this is a different comp). I am using gnome
there is an package that is called wifi-radar, install it if you can and try to connect using that , or
configure your card , manual, and not use roaming...
iconfig on terminal ( gnome desktop ) will give some info on the network
ok, let me try this. though I believe manual configuration also failed. I'll get back to you in a moment
, i have to go, but you can sure ask anyone here
